Funci√≥n: Bloque de codigo que esta nombrado. 

```{r}
pow_two <- function(x, print_info=TRUE){
y <- x^2
if(print_info){
  print(paste(x,"to the power two equals", y))
}
return (y)
}

result <- pow_two (3)
result


```

Function scoping

```{r}
pow_two <- function (x){
  y <- x^2
  return (y)
}

pow_two(4)


```

Other type of parameters

```{r}
linkedin <- c(16,9,13,5,2,17,14)

interpret <- function(num_views){
  if(num_views>15){
    print ("you are popular!")
    return (num_views)
  }
  else{
    print("Try to be more visible!")
    return(0)
  }
}

interpret(linkedin[1])

interpret_all <- function(views, return_sum=TRUE){
  count <- 0
  
  for (v in views){
    count <- count + interpret(v)
  }
  
  if (return_sum){
    return(count)
  }else {
    return(NULL)
  }
}

interpret_all (linkedin)

```

Use Apply with R

Lapply

```{r}
temp <- list(c(3,7,9,6,1), c(6,9,12,13,5), c(4,8,3,-1,-3), c(1,4,7,2,-2), c(5,7,9,4,2), c(-3,5,8,9,4), c(3,6,9,4,1))

select <- function (x){
  print (mean(x))
  
}

list <- lapply (temp, select)
list()

lapply(temp,min)



```

otra forma de hacer lo que hizo Lappy es con un ciclo for:

```{r}
for (t in temp){
  print(min(t))
}
```

lapply and anonymous functions

```{r}
(function(x,y) {3*x*y})(9,10)

pioneers <- c ("GAUSS:1777", "BAYES:1702", "PASCAL:1623", "PEARSON:1857")
split <- strsplit(pioneers, split=":")

split_low <- lapply(split, tolower)

names <- lapply(split_low, function(x){x[1]}) 
names

years <- lapply(split_low, function(x){x[2]}) 
years 

```
Use lapply with additional arguments
```{r}

select_el <- function(x, index){
  x[index]
}

names <- lapply(split_low, select_el, 1 )
names

years <- lapply(split_low, select_el, 2 )
years

```

Sapply

```{r}

temp <- list(c(3,7,9,6,1), c(6,9,12,13,5), c(4,8,3,-1,-3), c(1,4,7,2,-2), c(5,7,9,4,2), c(-3,5,8,9,4), c(3,6,9,4,1))

extremes <- function(x){
  c(min=min(x),max=max(x))
}

lapply(temp, extremes)
sapply(temp, extremes)

temp2 <- list(1,2,3,4,5)
func_temp2 <- function(x){
  x
}

lapply(temp2,func_temp2)
sapply(temp2,func_temp2)



```

vapply

```{r}

basics <- function(x){
  c(min=min(x),mean=mean(x), max=max(x))
}

lapply(temp, basics)
sapply(temp, basics)
vapply(temp, basics, numeric(3))

temp3 <- c("Guatemala", "Salvador", "Honduras", "Nicaragua")

unique_letters <- function (name){
  bane <- gsub ("","", name)
  letters <- strsplit(name, split="")[[1]]
  unique(letters)
  
}

lapply(temp3,unique_letters)
sapply(temp3,unique_letters)
vapply(temp3, unique_letters, nchar(7))


```

grep & grepl

```{r}

emails <- c("john.doe@ivyleague.edu", "education@world.gov", "dalai.lama@peace.org",
            "invalid.edu", "quant@bigdatacollege.edu", "cookie.monster@sesame.tv")


grepl(pattern=".edu", x=emails)

grepl("edu", emails)
```
